content.description: The distribution of ocean wave height at a certain California beach is approximately normal with mean 7.2 feet. The distribution of ocean wave height at a certain Florida beach is approximately normal with mean 6.6 feet. Six waves from each beach will be selected at random and the heights will be recorded. Let <math alttext="x bar sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sample mean height of the 6 California waves, and let <math alttext="x bar sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sample mean height of the 6 Florida waves.
content.question: Which of the following is the best interpretation of <math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, x bar sub C minus x bar sub F is greater than 0.5, close parenthesis, is equal to 0.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The probability that the heights for all 6 California waves will exceed the heights for all 6 Florida waves by more than 0.55 feet is 0.5.
The probability that the heights for all 6 California waves will exceed the heights for all 6 Florida waves by more than 0.5 feet is 0.55.
The probability of observing a difference (California minus Florida) greater than 0.5 feet between the mean height of 6 California waves and the mean height of 6 Florida waves is 0.55.
The probability of observing a difference greater than 0.5 feet between the height of one wave in California and the height of one wave in Florida is 0.55.
The probability of observing a difference greater than 0.55 feet between the height of one wave in California and the height of one wave in Florida is 0.5.

content.answer: The probability of observing a difference (California minus Florida) greater than 0.5 feet between the mean height of 6 California waves and the mean height of 6 Florida waves is 0.55.

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
